description.narrative: Child protection policies, legislation and Standard Operating Procedures reviewed, amended and/or developed based on knowledge and capacity to protect children is strengthened

sector.narrative: Access to child-friendly police and justice sector services
Administrative data and Information Management System (IMS) including CPIMS+, GBVIMS+, MRMIMS+
Public finance management for child protection
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse
Social welfare workforce systems strengthening (accreditation, staffing and supervision)
Technical assistance - Prevention and response services for violence against children
Violence, exploitation, and abuse - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use

description.narrative: Justice, Law and Order policy, planning and administration
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: Sri Lanka Country Programme Action Plan
Sri Lanka Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Overview)
UNICEF Programmes in Sri Lanka (Emergency Response)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2019 Sri Lanka: Evaluability assessment of the UNICEF Sri Lanka Country Programme
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Child protection policies, legislation and Standard Operating Procedures reviewed, amended and/or developed based on knowledge; and capacity to protect children is strengthened

description.narrative: Intense advocacy resulted in increasing the minimum age of criminal responsibility from 8-12 years, which will reduce the number of children placed in institutions and in contact with the justice system. The Government is also reviewing UNICEF's recommendations to reform the legal/institutional framework focusing on justice for children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: # CP officers received CP Diploma certificate (SDDP project areas)
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Existence of procedures and services for children in contact with law that are applied and delivered in line with international norms

(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Key articles of the CRC (Art 19, Art 34 and Art 38 + Optional Protocol on the sale of children, child prostitution and child pornography and Optional Protocol on the involvement of children in armed conflict) dealing with violence, exploitation and abuse have been domesticated into national legislation

baseline.value: The current legislation sets the minimum age for criminal responsibility at 8

target.value: 2017:Legislation amended to increase the minimum age of criminal responsibility to 12

actual.value: 2017:National policy was amended to increase the minimum age of criminal responsibility to 12
